Description: Body sherd of East Greek (North Ionian?) pottery bowl; buff-brown clay with some silver mica; interior streaky black with added red band lined in white; exterior: reserved with glazed area at top and band below it; inscription cut upside down on lower wall.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 66, no. 802, pl. XXI, no. 802)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 687, no. 450)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.353)
